discussion.content:

questions.question_text: A company recently discovered that it could save money by moving its call center to another country. The company entered into an agreement for call center services. Which of the following types of organizational change is this?
Team members in a projectized organization are released at the end of a project and placed on the `bench`. Which of the following should the benched team members do NEXT?

choices.B: Check in with a functional manager.

discussion.content: how can they check with functional manager in projectized organization?
I would say A, because the project manager would be looking for a new project as well. If anything they both should report to the PMO.

B

In a projectized organization, team members are typically managed by a project manager while they are working on a project. However, when team members are released at the end of a project and placed on the "bench," their management and reporting structure may change.

In some cases, benched team members may report to a functional manager or a resource manager who is responsible for overseeing staffing and resource allocation for the organization. In this case, it would be appropriate for benched team members to check in with the functional manager to discuss their status, availability, and potential project opportunities.

Selected Answer: C
Answer is C. report to PM

Typically, functional managers do not exist in Projectized Organizational Structures. If there is one, his power or authority is very limited. Organizations give project managers authority and power as needed to complete the project but this does not mean that he has absolute authority to do everything he wants.
The resource would report to the PM to be reassigned

Selected Answer: C
In projectized organizations, the PM calls the shots. The resources work for the PM. These resources belong to the PM's project alone and has authority. A drawback is that the team needs to know "what next" at the end of the project. This can cause a little anxiety for my team.
answer is A, find new project

questions.question_text:
A project manager is creating the WBS.
In which of the following phases is the project?
questions.answer_description: Reference: Kim Heldman, CompTIA Project+ Study Guide, 2nd Edition, Sybex, Indianapolis, 2017, p. 139

discussion.content:
The project is in the Planning phase when the project manager is creating the Work Breakdown Structure (WBS).

In the Initiation phase, the project is just starting, and the project manager is defining the scope and objectives of the project.

In the Execution phase, the project manager is carrying out the work defined in the project plan, including implementing the WBS.

In the Closing phase, the project manager is wrapping up the project, including completing any remaining work, conducting a final review, and closing out the project.

Selected Answer: B
Correct

B. WBS is created in the planning stage.
B. The WBS is one of the key documents created at the end of the Planning phase.

The BEST source for high-level project requirements is the sponsor. Therefore, option A is the correct answer.

The project sponsor is the person or group that initiates the project and provides the funding and resources necessary for the project's success. They are responsible for defining the project's business objectives and ensuring that the project aligns with the organization's strategic goals. As such, they are the best source for high-level project requirements as they can provide the necessary context and insight to ensure that the project charter reflects the organization's needs and goals.
